intro: Hieracium parcicrinum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. It features small yellow flowers surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Hieracium parcicrinum is often found in open habitats and is adapted to temperate climates.
